name: backspin
content:
backspin noun
(SPORTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the movement of a ball turning round very quickly in the air or on a surface so that the ball moves backwards after landing or hitting something: The backspin on his approach to the green took the ball back towards the hole. The ball got so much back spin on it that when it landed, it bounced back into the net. Synonym
underspin
More examplesFewer examplesShe put a lot of backspin on her backhand drop shot.A screw shot in pool or snooker is one that applies a lot of back spin to the cue ball.He was practising his backspin at the table tennis table.There was backspin on the ball, which deceived the goalkeeper, and the forward was able to nip in and score.

backspin noun
(DESCRIPTION)
[ U ] mainly US a way of describing or discussing something that attempts to change its meaning, or change how people think about it, after it has happened: No amount of backspin by publicists can alter the fact that the club is in trouble. The newspaper added to the backspin against military action with a critical piece.
More examplesFewer examplesIf you apply enough ironic backspin, almost any American novel could be described as "American Pastoral".

backspin noun
(DANCE MOVE)
[ C ] the action of moving your body quickly around in circles while lying on your back, as part of a dance: 50 competitors showed off their robot dances and backspins. The routine included moves such as the backspin, where you lie on your back and spin round.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dancing is heavily influenced by ballet, though I spotted several breakdancing moves, including the backspin. There were a lot of men in baggy trousers doing back spins to disco music.

backspin noun
(MUSIC)
[ C or U ] the action of spinning a record, or playing recorded music, backwards in order to find a particular place in the recording or to achieve a particular sound effect: DJs use backspin to transition between tracks. You can improve your mix with a well-placed backspin.
